intro: Chrysosplenium griffithii var. griffithii, commonly known as the Himalayan pennywort, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It features small, heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions with cool climates. Its botanical characteristics make it a unique and valuable species in alpine ecosystems.
